purpose: Engineer features to predict residential electricity consumption patterns for load forecasting.
raw_table:
CustomerID,Date,Region,Consumption(kWh),Tariff,Temperature,CleanEnergy
C101,2023-02-01,North,345,kwh-std,15C,Yes
C102,2/2/2023,South, 412 ,KWH-Std,18 Celsius,No
C103,2023/02/03,East,NaN,kwh-premium,20c,yes
c104,02-04-2023,South,378,kwh-Std,19C,No

fe_steps: Standardize Date column to ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Fill missing Consumption(kWh) and Temperature values with the median of their respective columns.
Correct inconsistent capitalization and whitespace in Region and Tariff columns.

Convert Temperature strings to numeric Celsius values.

Create a new feature consumption_per_degree by dividing Consumption(kWh) by Temperature.
Flag rows with originally invalid Consumption entries as a binary indicator 'invalid_consumption'.

purpose: Engineer features to predict customer churn based on purchase behavior and demographics.
fe_steps: Standardize date formats in SignupDate and LastPurchaseDate columns to YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing SignupDate and LastPurchaseDate with the earliest SignupDate and latest LastPurchaseDate respectively
Convert TotalSpend to numeric, replacing non-numeric or invalid entries with median spend
Normalize capitalization in FavoriteCategory and IsPremiumMember columns
Convert NumReturns from string to integer, replacing non-numeric entries with zero
Create a new feature DaysSinceLastPurchase as the difference in days between a fixed reference date (2023-03-21) and LastPurchaseDate
Create a membership binary feature IsPremium with 1 for Yes and 0 for No
One-hot encode FavoriteCategory into dummy variables
Bucketize TotalSpend into three categories: Low (<600), Medium (600-1000), High (>1000)
Create a new feature ReturnRate as NumReturns divided by total number of purchases approximated by total spend divided by average order value (assumed 100)
Standardize numeric columns DaysSinceLastPurchase, TotalSpend, and ReturnRate

purpose: Engineer features to assess customer creditworthiness for loan approval prediction.

Create binary feature 'HasExistingLoans' where ExistingLoans > 0 is 1 else 0
Extract 'ApplicationMonth' from ApplicationDate
Bucketize CreditScore into categories: Low (<670), Medium (670-700), High (>700)

Extract pickup_hour from Pickup_datetime
Create a binary feature is_peak_hour where peak hours are defined as 7-9 AM and 4-6 PM
Map Vendor_id to numeric IDs (V1=1, V2=2)

purpose: Engineer features for predicting hospital readmission risk based on patient demographic and clinical data.

Impute missing Age values with the median Age
Normalize Gender values to title case (Male, Female)
Map Severity labels to numeric scale: Mild=1, Moderate=2, Severe=3
Extract systolic and diastolic blood pressure as separate numeric columns from Blood_Pressure
Flag high cholesterol if Cholesterol_mg_dl > 240
Bucketize Age into ranges: <30='Young', 30-50='Middle-aged', >50='Senior'
Standardize Weight_kg by converting missing or string entries to median weight
One-hot encode Diagnosis_Code

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting bus arrival delays based on trip and weather data.
fe_steps: Standardize Route names to uppercase
Parse Start_Time and End_Time into datetime objects, handling mixed formats
Create Trip_Duration_minutes by computing the difference between End_Time and Start_Time
Fill missing End_Time with Start_Time plus average trip duration per Route
Extract Start_Hour and Day_of_Week from Start_Time
Normalize Driver_Name capitalization to title case
Map Weather to standardized categories: Sunny, Rain, Cloudy
Convert Temperature to numeric Celsius, removing 'C' and handling missing values by imputation
Map Crowd_Level to ordinal numeric scale: low=1, medium=2, high=3
Create Speed_km_per_hr by dividing Distance_km by Trip_Duration_hours
One-hot encode Route

purpose: Engineer features from raw climate observation data to support temperature anomaly prediction models.
fe_steps: Standardize the Date column into ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing or non-numeric Temp_C values with the mean temperature of the respective station
Convert Precipitation_mm missing values to zero
Replace non-numeric Wind_Speed_kmh entries with the median wind speed
Normalize capitalization in Weather_Condition and group similar categories into three classes: Sunny, Cloudy, and Partly Cloudy
Extract day_of_week from the Date column
Create a binary feature indicating if Precipitation_mm is greater than 0
Calculate temperature difference from station-wise mean temperature as Temp_Anomaly
Bucketize Wind_Speed_kmh into 'Low', 'Medium', and 'High' categories based on terciles
One-hot encode Weather_Condition classes

purpose: Create enriched features for predicting customer churn based on purchase and engagement history.
fe_steps: Parse SignupDate and LastPurchaseDate into standardized datetime format
Calculate DaysSinceLastPurchase as the difference in days from the LastPurchaseDate to a reference date 2023-04-15
Impute missing TotalSpend values with the median TotalSpend
Convert TotalSpend and NumPurchases to numeric types, correcting stray strings where necessary
Normalize PreferredCategory values to lowercase and map category variants to unified categories (electronics, clothing, home & garden)
Map MembershipStatus to an ordinal numeric scale: Bronze=1, Silver=2, Gold=3
Create AverageSpendPerPurchase as TotalSpend divided by NumPurchases, handling division by zero
Create a flag RecentSignup indicating if SignupDate is within the last year from 2023-04-15
Fill missing SignupDate with the mode of the SignupDate column

purpose: Engineer features from patient visit data to predict hospital readmission risk.
fe_steps: Standardize the Gender column to have values 'Male' or 'Female' only
Convert Visit_Date to ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) and extract visit_month and visit_day_of_week
Impute missing Age values with the median age
Clean BMI column by replacing non-numeric or missing values with median BMI
Map Diagnosis_Code to uppercase and correct spacing, then one-hot encode top 3 diagnosis groups (E11, I10, E78)
Convert Smoker column to binary: 1 for Yes, 0 for No or variants
Impute missing Last_HbA1c values with the mean HbA1c
Create age_bucket feature: 'Under 40', '40-59', '60 and above'
Standardize Age, BMI, and Last_HbA1c columns using z-score normalization

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting machine failure within a production line.

Compute FailureRiskScore as a weighted sum: 0.3*OperatingHours + 0.4*Temperature + 0.3*ErrorCount
Bucketize FailureRiskScore into Low, Medium, High risk groups

purpose: Engineer features from raw social media user data to predict user engagement levels.
fe_steps: Parse JoinDate and LastActive columns into standardized date format YYYY-MM-DD
Calculate account_age_days as the number of days between JoinDate and LastActive; if LastActive is missing, use current date 2023-04-10
Impute missing Followers values with median Followers
Convert Followers from string format with suffixes (e.g., '2.2k') to integer numbers
Fill missing Posts values with zero and convert to integer
Normalize Country names to uppercase and consolidate variants (e.g., 'usa', 'USA', 'Usa' -> 'USA')
Standardize AccountType to lowercase
One-hot encode AccountType
Bucketize Followers into categories: 'Low' (<500), 'Medium' (500-1500), 'High' (>1500)
Create engagement_score as Posts divided by account_age_days

purpose: Engineer features for modeling daily temperature anomalies and precipitation patterns to support climate trend analysis.
fe_steps: Standardize Date column to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Convert all WeatherCondition values to lowercase
Map WeatherCondition to numeric severity scale: clear=0, fog=1, cloudy=2, rain=3
Convert Precipitation to numeric, treating 'trace' and 'none' as 0.0
Fill missing TempC values with the mean temperature of the corresponding StationID
Create a binary feature 'IsPrecipitating' indicating if Precipitation > 0
Extract day_of_week from Date column as an integer (Monday=0)
Calculate rolling 3-day average temperature per StationID
Standardize WindSpeed_kmh column, treating 'NA' as missing and imputing with median wind speed

purpose: Engineer features from social media user activity data to predict user engagement levels.

Create DaysActive as the difference in days between LastActive and JoinDate
One-hot encode AccountType after standardizing case
Map Verified column from TRUE/FALSE strings to binary 1/0
Create EngagementRate feature as PostCount divided by DaysActive
Bucketize Followers into 'Low', 'Medium', 'High' categories based on quantiles

Convert WindSpeed to numeric km/h, removing 'km/h' and spaces
Impute missing Temperature and Humidity values using median per StationID
Create a temperature to humidity ratio feature
Bucketize Temperature into Low (<20), Moderate (20-25), High (>25)

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting house sale prices by cleaning and transforming raw real estate data.
fe_steps: Standardize 'DateListed' column to ISO YYYY-MM-DD format, filling missing dates with the median date

Bucketize 'Bedrooms' into categories: 1-2=Small, 3=Medium, 4-5=Large
Fill missing 'Bedrooms' with the mode of the dataset
Standardize 'Price' and 'LotSize' using z-score normalization

purpose: Engineer features from raw climate sensor data to improve temperature anomaly detection models.

Extract day_of_week from Date column
Convert WindSpeed to numeric by removing non-numeric characters
Impute missing WindSpeed with mean WindSpeed
One-hot encode WeatherCondition
Create Temperature_Humidity_Ratio as Temperature divided by Humidity
Bucketize WindSpeed into categories: Low (<8 km/h), Medium (8-12 km/h), High (>12 km/h)

Replace invalid trip_distance values ('abc') and missing values with median trip_distance
Impute missing Driver_rating with the mean Driver_rating
One-hot encode Payment_type
Extract pickup_hour and pickup_day_of_week from Pickup_DateTime
Map RateCode 'Standard' and numeric codes (1,2,3) to categorical labels: 1->'Standard', 2->'Airport', 3->'Downtown'

Standardize Driver_rating to zero mean and unit variance

purpose: Engineer features to predict customer purchase propensity based on browsing and transaction history.

Calculate DaysSinceLastLogin as difference between reference date and LastLogin, fill missing with max days
Clean TotalSpend by replacing non-numeric entries with median spend and fill missing values similarly
Standardize PreferredCategory by capitalization and map similar categories to unified labels
Fill missing BrowsingDuration with median browsing time
Create SpendPerDay by dividing TotalSpend by DaysSinceSignup
Bucketize TotalSpend into three categories: Low, Medium, High spenders
One-hot encode the cleaned PreferredCategory
Normalize BrowsingDuration using min-max scaling

purpose: Engineer robust features from raw real estate listings to improve price prediction accuracy.

One-hot encode PropertyType and Location.
Create price_per_sqft by dividing Price by SizeSqFt.
Bucketize Bedrooms into categories: '1-2', '3+'.
Fill missing Bathrooms with the mean number of bathrooms per PropertyType.

purpose: Engineer features from raw real estate listings data to improve property price prediction accuracy.
fe_steps: Standardize Listing_Date to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing Bathrooms values with median number of bathrooms
Clean Size_sqft by removing non-numeric characters and converting to integer
Convert Price to numeric by removing currency symbols and commas
Normalize Location values to title case and fill missing values with 'Unknown'
Convert Sale_Status to lowercase and map 'available' and 'pending' to 0, 'sold' to 1
Create Price_per_sqft by dividing Price by Size_sqft
Extract Listing_Month from Listing_Date
Bucketize Bedrooms into categories 'Small' (<=2), 'Medium' (3), 'Large' (>=4)

purpose: Engineer features to predict customer churn likelihood based on user behavior and transaction history.
fe_steps: Parse SignupDate and LastPurchase columns into consistent date format
Fill missing SignupDate values with the median signup date
Convert TotalSpend to numeric, replacing non-numeric or missing values with median spend
Normalize MembershipLevel variants to Title Case (e.g., 'Gold', 'Silver', 'Platinum', 'Bronze')
Standardize Country names to uppercase ISO codes (e.g., USA, UK, CANADA to USA, UK, CAN)
Convert AvgSessionTime to numeric minutes, handling variations like '35 min', '40', '33', '36 minutes'
Fill missing AvgSessionTime and SupportTickets with the column median and zero respectively
Create feature 'DaysSinceLastPurchase' as the difference in days between last purchase date and a reference date '2023-04-21'
One-hot encode MembershipLevel
Bucketize TotalSpend into spend tiers: low (<400), medium (400-550), high (>550)

One-hot encode CallType and Network columns after normalization
Calculate AvgDataUsagePerCall as DataUsage divided by CallDuration
Standardize numeric columns CallDuration, DataUsage, and AvgDataUsagePerCall

fe_steps: Standardize AdmissionDate to ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Correct Age by imputing missing values with median age
Normalize Gender to 'Male' and 'Female'

purpose: Engineer features for predicting crop yield based on weather, soil, and planting data.
fe_steps: Standardize Crop names to title case
Standardize SoilType names to lowercase and trim whitespace
Parse PlantingDate and HarvestDate columns uniformly into ISO format
Impute missing Rainfall_mm values with the median rainfall
Convert Temperature_C entries from strings to numeric, imputing missing or invalid as mean temperature
Calculate GrowingPeriodDays as the difference in days between HarvestDate and PlantingDate
One-hot encode the SoilType categorical variable
Create RainfallBucket by binning Rainfall_mm into low (<90), medium (90-130), and high (>130) categories
Log-transform the Yield_kg to reduce skewness
Standardize Temperature_C and GrowingPeriodDays columns

purpose: Engineer features from social media user activity data to improve engagement prediction models.
fe_steps: Standardize signup_date and last_active columns to ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Impute missing signup_date with the median signup_date
Impute missing last_active dates with the most recent last_active date in the dataset
Convert posts_count and followers_count to numeric, handling missing values and removing non-numeric characters like 'K' and commas
Create a new feature followers_count_numeric representing followers_count as an integer
Extract day_of_week from last_active date
Map user_tier to a numeric scale: Bronze=1, Silver=2, Gold=3
One-hot encode account_status with categories Active and Inactive
Create a feature activity_recency_days as number of days between last_active and signup_date
Bucketize posts_count into three categories: Low (0-7), Medium (8-15), High (16+)

purpose: Engineer features for forecasting daily electricity consumption based on smart meter and weather data.
fe_steps: Standardize Date column to ISO format yyyy-mm-dd
Fill missing Consumption_kWh values with the median consumption per MeterID
Convert Consumption_kWh to numeric, coercing invalid entries to NaN and then filling them
Impute missing Temperature values with the average temperature for that Date
Normalize WeatherCondition strings to lowercase
One-hot encode WeatherCondition
Extract day_of_week from Date
Compute a 3-day rolling average Consumption_kWh per MeterID
Create a binary feature indicating if the day is weekend or not
Standardize Temperature and Consumption_kWh columns

purpose: Engineer robust features from raw climate sensor data to improve accuracy in forecasting temperature anomalies.
fe_steps: Standardize Date column to ISO yyyy-mm-dd format
Fill missing Temp_C values by linear interpolation within each StationID
Impute missing Humidity values using median humidity per Weather_Condition
Clean Wind_Speed_kmh by removing non-numeric characters and convert to float
Map Weather_Condition variants to standardized categories: Clear, Rain, Cloudy
Extract day_of_week from Date
Calculate temperature anomaly as difference between Temp_C and mean Temp_C per StationID
One-hot encode Weather_Condition categories
Bucketize Wind_Speed_kmh into Low (<=10), Medium (11-15), High (>15) categories

purpose: Create model-ready features to predict customer churn based on transaction and engagement data.
raw_table:
CustomerID,JoinDate,LastPurchaseDate,TotalSpent,AvgBasketSize,Segment,FeedbackScore
C001,2023-01-15,03/20/2024,$1200,5,regular,Good
C002,15-02-2023,2024-02-28,850usd,3,Regular,Excellent
c003,2023/03/05,2024-03-15,NaN,2,VIP,poor
C004,2023-04-10,04-10-2024,450, Four,VIP, 
C005,2023-05-22,,300 USD,1,regular,average
C006,07/07/2023,2024-07-01,$700,3,REGULAR,Good
c007,2023-08-01,2024/08/15,950,5,VIP,Good
C008,2023-09-12,2024-09-10,550usd,2,regular,Poor
C009,,2024-10-05,400,2,VIP,Excellent
C010,2023-11-01,11/20/2024,NaN,,Regular,Average
fe_steps: Standardize all date columns (JoinDate and LastPurchaseDate) to ISO format yyyy-mm-dd
Fill missing LastPurchaseDate with JoinDate plus 90 days
Convert TotalSpent to numeric by removing currency symbols and non-numeric characters
Convert AvgBasketSize to numeric and fill missing or non-numeric values with median basket size
Normalize Segment values to lowercase
Map FeedbackScore to numeric scale: poor=1, average=2, good=3, excellent=4
Calculate DaysSinceLastPurchase as difference between current date (assumed 2024-11-01) and LastPurchaseDate
Create a boolean feature IsVIP where Segment equals 'vip'
Bucketize TotalSpent into categories: low (<500), medium (500-1000), high (>1000)
Compute SpendingPerBasket as TotalSpent divided by AvgBasketSize

fe_steps: Standardize CallDate to ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) and fill missing dates with the mode date.
Convert CallDuration to numeric, replacing non-numeric or missing values with zero.
Normalize CallType values to lowercase categories: 'voice' or 'text'.
Fill missing PlanType values with the most frequent plan type.
Convert MonthlySpend to numeric, replacing non-numeric or missing values with the median spend.
Extract the day_of_week from CallDate.
Create a binary feature is_premium_plan indicating if PlanType is 'premium'.
Bucketize CallDuration into 'short' (<60s), 'medium' (60-180s), and 'long' (>180s).
Calculate average spend per call by dividing MonthlySpend by total calls per customer (assume each row is one call).
One-hot encode CallType and CallDuration bucket categories.

Fill missing values in 'post_text' with the string 'no_text'.
Convert likes, comments, and shares columns to numeric, handling non-numeric strings by mapping them to NaN, then fill NaN with zero.
Create a new feature 'total_engagement' as the sum of likes, comments, and shares.
One-hot encode the post_type column into separate binary indicator columns.
Create a binary feature 'has_hashtag' indicating whether the post_text contains the '#' symbol.
Bucketize total_engagement into three categories: low (0-10), medium (11-30), and high (31+), naming the feature 'engagement_level'.

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting taxi trip duration based on trip details and passenger data.
fe_steps: Standardize Pickup_DateTime and Dropoff_DateTime to a consistent datetime format
Fill missing Passenger_count values with the median passenger count
Correct Fare_amount by replacing non-numeric or missing values with the median fare
Convert Payment_Type to lowercase and one-hot encode it
Calculate trip_duration in minutes as the difference between Dropoff_DateTime and Pickup_DateTime
Compute tip_percentage as (Tip_amount / Fare_amount) * 100, fill missing tips with zero
Bucketize trip_duration into categories: short (<15), medium (15-30), long (>30) minutes
Create a feature day_of_week extracted from Pickup_DateTime
Standardize numeric columns: Fare_amount, Trip_distance, trip_duration, tip_percentage
Create a fare_per_mile feature as Fare_amount divided by Trip_distance

purpose: Engineer features to predict customer purchase propensity based on browsing and transaction history.
fe_steps: Standardize date columns SignupDate and LastLogin to ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) and impute missing SignupDate with the median signup date
Fill missing numeric values in TotalSpent and PurchaseCount with column medians
Clean TotalSpent column by removing currency symbols and converting to float
Normalize capitalization in FavoriteCategory and merge similar categories (e.g., Electronics and electronics, Home Appliances and home appliances)
Extract SignupMonth from SignupDate
Create a binary feature IsActive indicating if LastLogin is within 30 days of 2023-03-12
Compute AverageSpentPerPurchase as TotalSpent divided by PurchaseCount
Bucketize AvgSessionTime into categories: Low (<20), Medium (20-35), High (>35)
One-hot encode FavoriteCategory
Standardize numeric columns TotalSpent, PurchaseCount, AvgSessionTime, and AverageSpentPerPurchase

purpose: Engineer features from farm sensor and crop data to predict crop yield performance.
fe_steps: Standardize CropType to lowercase
Parse PlantDate and HarvestDate into datetime objects despite mixed formats
Impute missing SoilMoisture values using median SoilMoisture of the same CropType
Convert Temperature(C) to numeric, replacing non-numeric with median temperature
Fill missing PestIncidents as zero and convert to integer
Map FertilizerUsed to ordinal scale: low=1, medium=2, high=3
Calculate GrowthDuration as days between PlantDate and HarvestDate
Bucket GrowthDuration into short (<200 days), medium (200-210 days), and long (>210 days)
One-hot encode CropType
Standardize numeric columns: SoilMoisture, Temperature, PestIncidents, GrowthDuration

purpose: Engineer features to predict customer churn based on usage patterns and demographics.
fe_steps: Standardize date formats in SignupDate and LastCallDate to YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing SignupDate values with the mode signup date
Convert MonthlySpending to numeric by removing currency symbols and invalid entries, imputing missing with median
Normalize PlanType values to title case
Impute missing TotalCalls with the median total calls
Impute missing SupportTickets with zero
Create 'DaysSinceLastCall' as the difference between a reference date (2022-12-01) and LastCallDate
Bucketize MonthlySpending into 'Low', 'Medium', and 'High' spending ranges
One-hot encode PlanType
Compute 'AvgCallsPerMonth' as TotalCalls divided by number of months since SignupDate
Flag customers with more than 2 SupportTickets as 'HighSupportNeeds'

purpose: Engineer numerical and categorical features from patient visit records to predict hospital readmission risk.
fe_steps: Standardize Gender values to 'Male' or 'Female' with capitalization normalized
Parse VisitDate to extract VisitMonth and VisitDayOfWeek
Fill missing Age values with median age
Impute missing Height_cm and Weight_kg with mean values
Extract systolic and diastolic BloodPressure as separate numeric columns
Convert Cholesterol_mg_dL to numeric, replacing non-numeric and missing with median
Calculate BMI using Height_cm and Weight_kg
One-hot encode DiagnosisCode, treating missing as 'Unknown'
Bucketize Age into categories: 'Young' (<40), 'Middle-aged' (40-59), 'Senior' (60+)

Normalize MerchantCategory values to lowercase and unify similar categories (e.g., 'groceries', 'grocery', 'groceriES' all mapped to 'groceries').
Standardize PaymentMethod values to consistent labels ('Credit Card' or 'Debit Card').
Convert IsInternational to a binary numeric feature (0 for 'No', 1 for 'Yes').
Extract the day_of_week from the TransactionDate.
Create a new feature TransactionAmount_log by applying the natural logarithm to the cleaned TransactionAmount.
Bucketize TransactionAmount into categories: Low (<50), Medium (50-150), High (>150).
One-hot encode MerchantCategory and PaymentMethod.
Create a new feature IsWeekend indicating if the transaction was on Saturday or Sunday.

purpose: Engineer features to predict machine failure within manufacturing equipment maintenance schedules.
fe_steps: Standardize the Machine_ID column to uppercase.
Parse Last_Maintenance dates into ISO format and impute missing dates with the mode date.
Convert Operating_Hours to numeric, replacing non-numeric entries with the median operating hours.
Fill missing Temperature values with the average temperature.
Normalize Operator_Shift values to lowercase and map variants ('day', 'daytime') to 'day', and others to 'night'.
One-hot encode the Operator_Shift column into two binary features: shift_day and shift_night.
Map Error_Code values to numeric severity: err01=1, err02=2, err03=3, err04=4; missing error codes imputed as 0.
Create a feature Days_Since_Maintenance by calculating the difference between a reference date (2023-03-15) and the Last_Maintenance date.
Apply a log transform to Operating_Hours to reduce skewness.
Standardize Temperature and Days_Since_Maintenance features to zero mean and unit variance.

fe_steps: Standardize all date columns (AdmissionDate and DischargeDate) to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Calculate Length_of_Stay as difference in days between DischargeDate and AdmissionDate
Impute missing Age values with the median age
Normalize Gender values to lowercase full words ('male' or 'female')
Standardize Diagnosis names to title case and unify variants (e.g., 'Diabetes TYPE 2' and 'diabetes type 2' to 'Diabetes Type 2')
Map Severity labels to numeric scale: low=1, moderate=2, severe=3
Convert FollowUp to binary: yes/y = 1, no/n = 0
Bucketize Age into groups: '<40', '40-55', '>55'
One-hot encode Diagnosis categories
Create a new feature HasFollowUp as boolean from FollowUp binary

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting taxi ride duration based on trip and passenger attributes.
fe_steps: Standardize start_time and end_time to ISO 8601 datetime format
Convert passenger_count to numeric, replacing non-numeric or missing values with the mode
Calculate trip_duration in minutes as difference between end_time and start_time
Impute missing trip_distance values using median distance for the corresponding pickup_location
Remove currency symbols and convert fare_amount to float
Extract hour_of_day and day_of_week from start_time
Normalize pickup_location and dropoff_location to title case
Create a binary feature is_airport_trip indicating if either pickup or dropoff is 'Airport'
Compute fare_per_mile as fare_amount divided by trip_distance
Bucketize trip_duration into short (<20 mins), medium (20-30 mins), and long (>30 mins)

purpose: Engineer and clean features from raw real estate listings to prepare for price prediction modeling.
fe_steps: Standardize DateListed column to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Clean Price column by removing currency symbols and commas, and convert to numeric
Fill missing Bedrooms and Bathrooms with median values grouped by PropertyType
Convert Neighborhood and PropertyType to title case for consistency
Impute missing Size_sqft values using median size per Neighborhood
Create a new feature price_per_sqft by dividing Price by Size_sqft
Extract year_listed from DateListed
Create age_of_property feature by subtracting YearBuilt from year_listed, filling missing YearBuilt with median year
One-hot encode Neighborhood and PropertyType columns
Fill missing YearBuilt values with median YearBuilt

Standardize Post_Type values to lowercase

Fill missing User_Followers with median follower count

Standardize numeric columns: Price, Area_sqft, Bedrooms, Bathrooms, HouseAge, price_per_sqft.

Calculate temperature anomaly by subtracting the mean temperature per StationID
One-hot encode the standardized Weather_Condition

Convert Credits_Completed to numeric, treating non-numeric as missing values and imputing with median.
Convert Attendance_Rate from percentage strings to numeric values and impute missing with mean attendance.
Create a binary Scholarship_Status flag where 'yes' or 'Yes' maps to 1 and 'no'/'No' to 0.

Fill missing GPA values with the overall mean GPA.
Bucketize GPA into three categories: 'low' (<3.0), 'medium' (3.0-3.5), 'high' (>3.5).
Normalize Credits_Completed and Attendance_Rate using min-max scaling.
One-hot encode the standardized Major column.

purpose: Engineer features from trip data to improve prediction of taxi fare amounts.
fe_steps: Standardize pickup_datetime and dropoff_datetime columns to ISO 8601 format
Extract day_of_week and hour_of_day from pickup_datetime
Convert trip_distance to numeric, replacing non-numeric values with median trip distance
Fill missing passenger_count values with the mode and convert all to integers
Normalize payment_type values to lowercase and unify variants ('credit card', 'credit') to 'credit_card', 'cash' as is
Calculate trip_duration in minutes as difference between dropoff_datetime and pickup_datetime
Create average_speed feature by dividing trip_distance by trip_duration
Fill missing fare_amount or non-numeric with median fare and convert to float
One-hot encode payment_type
Standardize numeric features: trip_distance, trip_duration, average_speed, fare_amount

purpose: Engineer features from user activity logs to improve prediction of post engagement levels.

Fill missing Shares and Comments with zero
Convert Likes, Shares, Comments to numeric, coercing errors to zero
Extract day_of_week from Post_Date
Create engagement_score as sum of Likes, Shares multiplied by 2, and Comments multiplied by 3

Flag missing Post_IDs with a binary feature missing_post_id

purpose: Engineer features from student enrollment and performance data to predict dropout risk.
fe_steps: Standardize enroll_date and last_login columns to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Impute missing GPA values with the mean GPA
Convert GPA from strings like 'Two point eight' to numeric 2.8 and handle any non-numeric entries
Convert credits_completed fields from strings like 'twenty' to numeric values and impute missing values with median
Normalize inconsistent major category labels into standardized categories: Computer Science, Biology, Physics
Convert attendance_rate percentages to numeric floats
Map scholarship_status (yes/no variants) to binary 1/0
Create a new feature days_since_last_login computed as difference between 2023-03-12 and last_login
Bucketize GPA into categories: Low (below 3.0), Medium (3.0-3.5), High (above 3.5)
Flag low attendance as a binary feature where attendance_rate < 85%
Calculate credits_per_month as credits_completed divided by months since enroll_date

purpose: Engineer robust features from heterogeneous climate sensor data to improve temperature anomaly prediction accuracy.
fe_steps: Standardize Date to ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Fill missing Temperature_C values with station-wise mean temperature
Convert Humidity_Percent missing or 'NA' entries to median humidity
Parse Wind_Speed_kmph, converting non-numeric entries to NaN and then filling with mean wind speed
Normalize Condition values to lowercase and unify similar categories: 'rainy' to 'rain', 'clear' to 'clear', 'cloudy' to 'cloudy'
Extract day_of_week from Date
Create a binary feature is_rain indicating if Condition is 'rain'
Bucketize Humidity_Percent into Low (<45), Medium (45-50), High (>50)
Calculate temperature_diff as difference between current Temperature_C and previous day Temperature_C for the same Station_ID
Standardize Temperature_C, Humidity_Percent, and Wind_Speed_kmph columns

purpose: Engineer features from raw climate sensor data to improve accuracy of temperature anomaly detection models.
fe_steps: Standardize Sensor_ID values to uppercase
Parse Timestamp to datetime format and extract hour of day and day of week
Convert Temperature_C to numeric, handling non-numeric strings as missing and then imputing with column median
Convert Humidity_Percent to numeric, treating 'missing' as missing values and imputing with column median
Standardize Weather_Condition categories to consistent lowercase values with predefined categories: sunny, rain, cloudy; map variants accordingly
Create a binary feature is_rainy indicating if Weather_Condition is rain
Calculate Temperature_Humidity_Index as Temperature_C minus (0.55 - 0.0055 * Humidity_Percent) * (Temperature_C - 14.5)
One-hot encode day of week extracted from Timestamp
Bucketize hour of day into 'Night' (0-5), 'Morning' (6-11), 'Afternoon' (12-17), 'Evening' (18-23)

Convert Station_ID to uppercase for consistency
Fill missing Temperature_C values using linear interpolation grouped by Station_ID
Replace non-numeric Precipitation_mm entries such as 'none' with 0 and convert column to float
Fill missing Wind_Speed_kmh values with the median wind speed
Normalize Weather_Cond by mapping all variants to one of these categories: 'Sunny', 'Clear', 'Partly Cloudy', 'Cloudy'
Extract day_of_week and month from the Date column
Create a binary feature 'High_Wind' indicating if Wind_Speed_kmh is greater than 15 km/h
Create a rolling 3-day average Temperature_C feature grouped by Station_ID
One-hot encode Weather_Cond into separate binary columns

purpose: Engineer features to predict user engagement levels on social media posts.
fe_steps: Standardize UserID values to lowercase.
Parse PostDate column into a consistent date format and extract day_of_week and is_weekend flag.
Normalize ContentType to lowercase and one-hot encode into separate binary columns.
Convert Likes, Shares, Comments, and UserFollowers to numeric, replacing non-numeric or missing values with zero.
Create a new engagement_score feature as the weighted sum: Likes*1 + Shares*2 + Comments*1.5.
Bucketize TextLength into three categories: short (<100), medium (100-200), long (>200).
Log-transform UserFollowers to reduce skewness.
Create a binary feature indicating if the post was made on weekend (is_weekend).

purpose: Engineer and clean clinical features to improve predictive modeling of patient readmission risk.
fe_steps: Standardize all date columns (Admission_Date and Discharge_Date) to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Calculate Length_of_Stay as days difference between Discharge_Date and Admission_Date
Normalize Doctor names to consistent capitalization format (e.g., 'Dr. Smith')
Map Diagnosis_Code values to uppercase standardized codes
Impute missing Age values using median age
Replace non-numeric Weight_kg entries ('unknown', 'missing') with median weight, then convert all weights to numeric
Extract Systolic_BP and Diastolic_BP as separate numeric columns from Blood_Pressure
Standardize Smoker_Status to boolean values (Yes/Y/yes -> True, No/N/no -> False)
Bucketize Age into categories: '<40', '40-50', '51-60', '>60'
One-hot encode Doctor and Diagnosis_Code columns
Create BMI feature assuming height fixed at 1.7m for all patients: BMI = Weight_kg / (1.7^2)

purpose: Engineer features to predict daily temperature anomalies based on weather station data.
fe_steps: Parse the Date column into a consistent date format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Fill missing Temperature_C values with the mean temperature of their respective Station_ID.
Convert all Weather_Condition entries to lowercase and standardize categories to: clear, partly cloudy, cloudy, rain, fog.
Extract day_of_week from the Date column.
Create a binary feature is_weekend indicating if the date falls on a weekend.
Convert Wind_Speed_kmh to numeric, setting 'not available' or invalid entries to the median wind speed.
Fill missing Humidity_Percent values with the median humidity.
One-hot encode the standardized Weather_Condition categories.
Calculate temperature_diff as the difference between Temperature_C and the average temperature of the Station_ID across the dataset.
Standardize numeric columns: Temperature_C, Humidity_Percent, Wind_Speed_kmh, temperature_diff to zero mean and unit variance.

purpose: Engineer features from raw property listing data to improve accuracy of house price prediction models.

One-hot encode PropertyType.
Create a binary feature HasGarage inferred as 1 if PropertyType is 'Single Family' and Bedrooms >= 4, else 0.

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting crop yield based on weather and soil conditions.
fe_steps: Standardize Crop names to title case
Parse Planting_Date into ISO yyyy-mm-dd format
Impute missing Rainfall_mm with median rainfall
Convert Harvest_Weight_kg to numeric, removing stray characters and imputing missing with mean
Normalize Soil_Type categories to lower case
Extract planting_month from Planting_Date
Create a rainfall_bucket feature by categorizing Rainfall_mm into low (<90), medium (90-120), and high (>120)
One-hot encode Soil_Type
Standardize Temperature_C to have zero mean and unit variance
Compute yield_per_mm_rainfall as Harvest_Weight_kg divided by Rainfall_mm

purpose: Engineer time-based, categorical, and numeric features from raw climate observations to improve the accuracy of temperature anomaly prediction models.
fe_steps: Standardize Date column to ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Convert Temperature_C to numeric, replacing invalid entries with the column mean.
Fill missing Humidity_pct values with median humidity.
Extract month and day_of_week from the Date column.
Normalize Weather_Condition values to lowercase and consolidate variants (e.g., 'sunny' and 'sunny' -> 'sunny').
One-hot encode the Weather_Condition column.
Extract numeric values from WindSpeed_kmh and convert to float; impute missing values with mean wind speed.
Create a new feature wind_speed_category by bucketizing WindSpeed_kmh into 'low', 'medium', and 'high'.

purpose: Engineer features from raw social media user activity data to build a model predicting user engagement levels.
fe_steps: Standardize date formats in join_date and last_active columns to YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing values in posts, likes_received, and comments_received with zero
Convert likes_received from strings to numeric, replacing non-numeric with zero
Calculate days_since_last_active as difference between 2023-03-28 and last_active
Compute average_engagement as (likes_received + comments_received) divided by posts, with zero posts handled as zero
Normalize user_type by mapping variants to consistent categories: Regular, Influencer, Newbie
One-hot encode user_type into separate binary columns
Bucketize days_since_last_active into three bins: 'active_recently' (0-7 days), 'active_past_month' (8-30 days), 'inactive' (31+ days)

Fill missing Content_Length values with median content length
Convert Likes and Comments columns to numeric, replacing non-numeric with median values
Extract day_of_week from Post_Date
Bucketize Content_Length into 'short', 'medium', and 'long' categories
Create interaction feature 'engagement' as sum of Likes and Comments
One-hot encode Post_Type categories

purpose: Engineer features to predict user engagement level on social media posts based on post metadata and user attributes.
fe_steps: Standardize post_date to ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Fill missing numeric values (likes, comments, shares) with median of respective columns
Normalize user_followers by converting shorthand (e.g., '1.2k') to numeric values
Convert post_type to lowercase
One-hot encode post_type
Create engagement_score as weighted sum: 0.5*likes + 0.3*comments + 0.2*shares
Extract post_weekday from post_date
Bucketize user_followers into bins: 'small' (<2000), 'medium' (2000-6000), 'large' (>6000)
One-hot encode user_followers bucket
